case.name: Medrad Inc v Alpine Medical Pty Ltd [2009] FCA 949 (25 August 2009)

citances.sentence: In AB Hassle v Pharmacia (Australia) Pty Ltd (1995) 33 IPR 63 at 76-77 Ashley J remarked on a tendency to treat "irreparable harm" as a consideration going to the balance of convenience, rather than as a distinct and antecedent consideration. This approach has been reflected in some decisions of this Court: see, for example, Marley New Zealand Limited v Icon Plastics Pty Ltd [2007] FCA 851 at [3] ; Medrad Inc v Alpine Medical Pty Ltd [2009] FCA 949 ; (2009) 82 IPR 101 at [38] .
